1IFFlOU6SE_7ORXKQsk-KQ.text: Whenever we visit London we rent an apartment in a different residential neighborhood, and the biggest advantage is discovering restaurants we never would have found if we were staying in a hotel in the heart of the tourist zone. This tiny restaurant has an extensive selection of kebabs and other Middle Eastern specialties, and everything we tried was delicious. Our favorite was the mixed grill with lamb and chicken kebabs and lamb kofte served with salad and pita bread. An enormous platter is only £6.75. Their hummus and tabbouli also are excellent.

gTDW147xPeMpjKZRjnCGGw.text: Taking great pride in using only the highest quality ingredients and freshest produce with no artificial preservatives as well the highest standard of lamb and chicken, this Turkish kebab restaurant has been serving up their succulent savouries since 1974. I can only regret not being around to enjoy all three of those decades of meaty wonder, but since discovering them back in 2001 I've been hooked ever since. And what's been reeling me in all these years is their glorious mixed grill. A mere £5.80 gets a mighty mound of lamb shish, chicken shish, lamb kofte and a doner kebab topping along with a grilled pita and plenty of salad and chilli sauce. The bits of grilled veg are nice 'n' chunky and the salad provides a plentiful bed of lettuce and red cabbage (not to mention some dangerously strong white onions). Even the pitas are a little tastier than those at other kebab joints. And the chilli sauce  oh the chilli sauce  well, I reckon it's a good contender for the best in London. All in all, Bosphorus Kebabs' large mixed grill (there's a small version priced at £4.75 and a massive extra large mix for £6.75) is an amazingly satisfying meal that's hard to beat.

K21DyXDg7EYXuvIKBgaWpQ.text: my favorite restaurant in london. i almost ate here exclusively on my many visits to london. delicious lamb. pictures of satisfied customers and celebrity visits all over the walls. and from what i remember a really friendly staff. this place is tiny, but don't overlook if if you ever pass by. i look forward to eating my first meal here the next time i land in london.

PWt3QViWXd1ja-z817UTjQ.text: I lived in S. Ken, in 1996 and LIVED on these things......I went back last month (March 2009) and it is as GREAT AS EVER.  Best kebab I have had anywhere.  Go now.

s42y6O_ZcQFZ2Fj5X0UYRA.text: Found this place through Yelp so though I'd pass on my findings.  Basically at this place you get and Awesome kebab!  Got the lamb and it was one of the best I've had in the area.  The only down side was that it took a long time to get served, and then there was another wait to pay at the end.  If you're after fast food this might not be the place, but the quality and taste is great.

BNNhNgEIieptxiukukrf0g.text: Nothing worse than order something you've had in the past and not getting what you expected.  Ordered the doner kabab and while it came with a small salad, the meat was cold and didn't come with any yogurt/white sauce that I so love.  The flatbread was warmed through but it does harden and makes it tough and chewy.  Knew I should've ordered the special salad options or the shish kabab (fresh) selection instead.  Nothing worse than ordering and longer for something else (and not having the stomach to fit it in...sigh).  The table side lemon juice was a nice touch though, helped the food go down.

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

VfMiTV4uyFTWRKbYoar22w.text: Some people say that this is the best kebab in London. Some people say that Elvis is still alive. Some people don't know what the hell they're talking about.It's good, but not great. Despite waiting a very long time for it, my food was cold and my bread was stale.On the plus side, they did have a good selection and everything is prepared to order.

3WCk5yV8iTyYJnjHbFMBzg.text: Just adding to the praise heap. Outstanding chicken shish today. Enjoyed the relative quiet & seating availability afforded by 4:30 p.m. arrival. Budget-friendly, palate pleasing. The embodiment of off-the-beaten path find.

dr8efnuKv3x1JVBRFaaF2Q.text: It looks like your typical kabab shop in London but it serves delicious turkish kababs. I went here for dinner around 7pm and there was a line. We had the mixed grill dish which was outstanding. Great place for a quick, healthy and cheap bite.

jkqQG7ZpgHTJfkuRA28I4w.text: Conveniently located steps from South Kensington tube station, this is a great place for a kebab.  We had the spicy lamb kebab and some hummus.  Both were excellent.  Service was efficient and the price was right.  You can spend a fortune to eat (or do anything else) in London so this place is a find for a simple, quick, tasty and inexpensive meal. And "spicy" doesn't really mean spicy so don't worry about that.

83jbpP9WH-Qvr-7REmSTsw.text: I have worked here some 20 years ago and can honestly say that the owner nows what he does and is the only Kebab takeaway i would recommend!The food and Meat are never Frozen and because the shop is very busy it has a fresh delivery every two days and all meats are prepared in house!!Mr Resat ,the owner has been running this establisment for about 30 years and if you go there please tell him you did so on my recommendation!!Tony Tasdemir

SLiFW0OZ1VRKYGEqbW4SVw.text: Bosphorus has one of the best kebabs I have ever eaten.. in my life. I used to live around the corner from here, so whenever I think about my time in London, Bosphorus is one of my great food memories. The kebabs were  pieces of succulent, perfectly marinated meat, fresh crunchy vegetables, and had a lip burning spiciness. I'm drooling already.. This place is always busy, but very, very efficient. Don't be afraid to jump in and get your order in.

v9cxQnHTjlhrb24aleimxw.text: Just came back from London and stayed down the street from Bosphorus.   It's a little hole-in-the-wall that seems to be quite popular with the locals in a pretty touristy area of South Kensington.  You walk in and the guys welcome you with a friendly "hello."  While waiting for your food, it's fun to read all the index cards on the wall written by visitors commenting on how amazing the food is.  Everyone seems to agree that they have the best kebabs in all of London.  Hole-in-the-wall prices, with great flavor!  I had the chicken kebab and bf had the donner kebab the two times we went.  What's great is that they're open late night as well!  Definitely a place to visit, especially when you're trying to avoid those London prices!

tlFktQRT5j09ATinPQ_iOw.text: There are certain things you are fairly sure of when you order a kebab and certain things that are very much left to chance. The meat is an example of the random chance, the quality can vary from tasty to food poisoning and you might also have some doubts from which beast it comes from. What I do generally always expect when I order a takeaway kebab is that, whatever the meat, it, along with the usual crew of salad and chilli sauce, will be wrapped up in some kind of bread.that you can walk and eatand try your damndest not to get any down the front of your shirt (this can mean doing a funny walkleaning forward). Here though, I was given my takeaway kebab in a foil takeaway receptacle. The kind you usually get your curry in. As if to complete the curry impression, the separate bread I was given resembled a small naan bread. So where was I supposed to eat the d*mn thing? I set off in search of a park but after finding 4 private parks in a row (all empty on s boiling hot daywhat a wastesilly posh toffs) I ended up having to just try and eat it stood out on the street. I was quite angry. Then I tasted the meatand it was goodbetter than good.could even say succulent? And the rage welling inside me was abated. This was really good food. I guess I should have said eat in. So in the end I am giving it a 2. 4 for the food and 1 for the service.. They could at least have warned me that what they were about to give me was not the norm. I am rounding it down to 2 because of the ridiculousness of serving take out in this way, in an area where its nigh impossible to find a humble bench, on which to sit. Still as the food was goodmy kebab odyssey (qype.co.uk/review/1024002) continues!

IoA_WrazKeDyLp5dj9JZpg.text: After a long flight I was walking around South Ken and stumbled across this hidden jewel. During my stay, I stopped in 1-2X a week for the chicken kabob, tabbouleh, and the ever-so-yummy chili sauce.  Clean eating before it was fashionable.  The food is so good.

N0tP3qVHVehPBeFwHi2jKA.text: I mean, yeah, it's good, It's just not the best I've had (Mohsen could be the best). It's probably great for, like, a drunk evening or something, but it won't be the best kebab you'd ever had.

jo2BU-AoCQlR9dUYkwRcBQ.text: My two kids and I spent a week in London in July. This was by far our favorite budget dinner place. Wonderful, fresh chicken kebabs and delicious bread. The hard-working men behind the grill were incredibly kind and gracious, especially to my children. We will definitely return on future trips to London!

aJg2iqQIxbli944cRGr9tg.text: Great food.  I always order the chicken breast.  Fresh grilled chicken breast, with lettuce, red cabbage, tomatoes, onion with the hot sauce, some yoghurt sauce and a pita.  It is a wonderful freshly cooked dinner.  The food is always excellent and I have been going for years.

_an18cVPbkLd_foX1OdhIw.text: Best Turkish Kebab outside Stoke Newington I have been a fan since the 70s when Bosphorous was a big restaurant next door that did takeaway. Very poplar with the Imperial College crowd and locals. Outstanding Turkish Kebbabs and superb chilli sauce. I recommend the Shish Kofte ! An esential part of the Golden Triangle on match days along with The Kings Head on Fulham Road (aka Finch's) even though they have ponced it up once too often now (and don't serve Youngs Winter Warmer) and of course Stamford Bridge the home of the mighty blues !

O12sfbSm5IU8T6P7hGWXhA.text: This is the best place for doners and kebabs! I can't count how many times I went here from when I first moved to London in '98 to the last time I visited London since I returned to San Francisco. Oh so good!

BPxxqK8EcrosQca1cbnEEg.text: Great little Kebab restuarant near South Kensington Station. The interior may be a bit run down but the Kebabs are excellent. While you are eating you can read the comment cards of the walls containing recommendations from traveller around the world and going back several years. Kebabs are about £3 to £5 and salad dishes are available.

qjaJNhN7bAyrBeRh0r6XlA.text: A phenomenal kebab shop in South Kensington. I attended Imperial College as part of a JYA program from Tulane University and was lucky to live in the South Ken area.  This was in 1997.  Shortly after arriving the local students and residents told me about this kebab shop and its incredible chicken and donner kebabs.  They were on the pulse.  The kebabs are incredibly flavorful and aren't overpriced.  I can't tell you how many times my friends and I ate there, but it was at least weekly if not more often.I've been back to London every few years to visit friends.  Every time we make it a routine to go to Bosphorus and it never disappoints.  The staff are friendly and always happy to see "alumni" return for more kebabs!

9T7gw30lsVhttq4vPIa3EQ.text: I lived just around the corner from Bosphorus and unfortunately only ate here once.  It did leave quite the impression though, as the kebab was spicy, delicious and piping hot.  I would certainly recommend Bosphorus for anyone with a hearty appetite; the portions are enormous

VZ8YYNe77uufm7FAn4_lpQ.text: Be warned: this is really a takeaway or deli, not what I'd call a "restaurant."  I was trying to find someplace for a relaxing lunch, I had read all terrific reviews of the food here (on Yelp plus other sites) so was looking forward to it, but was really taken aback when I arrived to see my choice for seating was either in plastic chairs on the sidewalk or in a corner of the kitchen - we're talking ZERO atmosphere, everyone walking by staring down at your plate, etc.  So, go for the takeaway! but for a nice place to sit, eat at La Bouchee across the street.

o00TWau8ul8NBrey0z0unw.text: Don't get me wrong, Bosphorus Kebabs dishes out a tasty meal in South Kensington for a fiver, which is an unbelievable feat in and of itself, however, there's just something not quite right about walking into a quaint but jam-packed kebab place when there's a Rolls-Royce parked out front and a Lamborghini dealership two doors down.  I do want to make it absolutely clear that the service at Bosphorus was absolutely impeccable, and arguably the best I've encountered in London.  Especially in South Kensington, where workers often have to spend the day dealing with mobs of tourists and the global elite, Bosphorus will treat everyone from the bin man to the Sultan of Oman as though they're locals, which is evident by the small complimentary note cards that pepper the walls.  Bosphorus' service alone bumped this review from 3 to 4 stars, and is a model of what even a quick bit out can look like when done right.While the food was good, portions are generally a bit small, and I was disappointed to find that some of the staples of most quick kebab joints were missing.  Bosphorus doesn't offer Doner wraps, which makes it difficult to eat their doners on the fly, and the classic garlic yogurt sauce and hot peppers were missing from their lineup of condiments.  That having been said, my lamb doner was somehow almost completely devoid of any dripping oil, which I'd never before encountered with London kebabs.So if you happen to be in South Kensington and are looking for a meal on the cheap, drop into Bosphorus for unmatched friendly service on the cheap.  However, if you're truly on the quest for the best kebab and are making your selection based on food quality alone, I've yet to find a kebab in the city that matches Pitfield Street's "City Best Kebab" just off the Old Street tube station.

99MhmxbqWdDij5pKWtoCMQ.text: my favorite kebabs in the world. whenever i am in london, i make a special trip just to eat the shish kofte. everything is fresh and delicious. dont miss the thick yogurt on top!

QeL1dtpVSeYXD0E7y6UNvQ.text: Been coming to the place for 25 years since I was a student and still come back EVERY time I am in town.  This is the real mccoy- great food, reasonable prices, and it has been around for 39 years....even as the neighborhood has gotten more posh over the years it is nice to see it still there.  Highly recommend for a meal or late night after some pints at the pub.

oatav7QjHb3R3R6_dtsQKA.text: The meat is excellent. The rest is not.I went on account of the fabulous reviews and ordered a Chicken Shawarma. The chicken was cooked right in front of me and ended up juicy and delicious. For London, the prices were good and the meat is definitely a stand-out. What I didn't like: the pita was hard as a rock, and the hummus had too sharp of a taste for me. I didn't like either. So make no mistake, if you come here you're coming for the meat. I will return, partially because I don't have the desire to put enough time into meat to make it taste as good as it does here.

XcNWDoD70nrRqOHlKmEodg.text: At the mention of 'going for a kebab' my inside shrink, having only tried them once in this country. My first (and as a consequence I'd decided last) still appears in my nightmares... fatty, oozing, strips of cheap meat, with heaps of pepper that I can only imagine was added to cancel out the taste of its former self. Whatever that was. When the work boys insisted on taking me to Bosphorus I was ready to think up any excuse as to why I couldn't make it. Ever.It turns out that the food at this little Turkish hot spot is INCREDIBLE. Although I still haven't dared to try the donnor either of the lamb or chicken shish are delicious. Now I'm a complete devote. The meat tastes fresh and is deliciously marinated and the best bit, you can watch it being cooked in front of you on their enormous grill whilst you chew the fat with the friendly Kebabeners (I made that up). They all come in a pitta or in a tray with fluffy white rice and salad. Whichever you go for do not miss their delicious garlic mayonnaise for 60p extra. I love the fact that they're keeping it real by still calling it that when the word 'aioli' has all but eradicated good old garlic mayo.Admittedly, I don't know much about kebab variants, but they seem to offer a great selection, such as Spicy Kofte (the boys favourite) and a great mixed grill. They also claim not to use any dodgy artificial additives so it's probably the healthiest kebab you're going to find after a night out. There's even a good choice of salads such as Kisir, Tabouleh (both bulgar wheat based) and Choban (cucumber, onion, pepper, radishes) so you can even take your veggie friends.The food is undoubtedly great, but the wait is long and service can sometimes be a bit on the brusque side. They seem to like to yelling, "Hey, lady, what dya want with this?" at you whilst you stand in the long winding queue of people, which on a Friday night after dancing till 3am can get a little exasperating (are you talking to me or her?!)But, for a kebab this good, I'm prepared to wait in that queue from as long as it takes and damn don't they know it.

8qWUCpeo2pHHuLh0FHCDQw.text: I like the kebabs a lot, but some of  the staff here are a bunch of flat out wankers. Its fucking annoying. Im always polite, some days they're nice some days they're just plain dickheads. Its enough to not make me want to go back ever again ive reached my limit now.I dont know what their problem is... ive even been waiting in line and seen them be rude or try to pass off smart ass comments to customers. Its like they have a chip on their shoulder or something, they need to get off their high horse and treat their customers with respect to make them feel like they want to go back.Hire some staff who enjoy their job and know a thing or two about customer satisfaction instead of letting their egos get in the way. I dont appreciate it when im a paying, polite and respectful customer and they talk to me and others like were pieces of shit.

-EAa8VT-tKFW9BRa86Q_Jw.text: This place fed me through Uni and I have my friend Ben to thank for introducing it to me. A true hole in the wall, it has been in its present location for over 20 years and serves up the freshest Turkish street food you can imagine.While there is very limited seating inside, your best bet is to take away your large doner with extra meat and chili sauce. Find somewhere you can eat it and get it everywhere... because it will go everywhere.Not cheap anymore, but the taste speaks of the quality ingredients. The local dog and rat population are intact :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

6D3hJF_wW3-5YKyQhHpKKA.text: If you are in the Kensington area and love food(I am assuming this is a given as you are on yelp) you owe it yourself to stop by this hole in the wall known as Bosphorus Kebabs!The Lamb Doner Kebab is ridiculously good. For those who don't know(I didn't either) a "Doner" kebab is the meat(usually lamb or chicken) sliced from the spit. Think of it as similar to gyro or shawarma.A "Shish" kebab is cubes of meat on a stick, sometimes with vegetables.I've had the Lamb Doner four times and can't imagine ordering something else. They slice the meat very thin, and it is juicy and so flavorful. I could eat a plate of the meat alone all by itself.Combine that with the pita bread they put on the grill and the outstanding red chilli sauce and it is perfection.No "lamby" taste that I'd had when I'd tried other lamb from spits.I actually had never liked lamb before Bosphorus!Don't let the hole in the wall look turn you away, Bosphorus is a winner!

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

UpLDxmy1IPY0m47i5ES2kg.text: Discovered this hole in the wall from fellow yelpers on my recent holiday in London. kebabs are great; went back a couple of times, add the chili sauce at your own risk. It can be HOT. Had the Doner, sheesh and seekh - lamb and chicken, they hit the right tastebuds.

CM339qM_lY_Y3nrVBrYfLw.text: Stopped into Bosphorus for lunch after searching yelp for some good and inexpensive food...great kebabs and friendly accommodating staff!   We had a doner kebab and a lamb-burger. Both were excellent and great quality meat.  Would definitely recommend this small spot for anyone looking for a great kebab for a great price.

LPkGiMul-8htJ-oiwGZwBQ.text: Good place to go when you're hungry and on budget. Food is very tasty and the staff is friendly and efficient.

pkyKUnhgE4xMlMZRLVNqdw.text: In late 2009 I actually died, and a couple of weeks later, I went to heaven. Here, let me show you how: You see that big fluffy white cloud over there with that dude sitting on it with the really long silver beard? That's god that is. You see that magnificent imposing Victorianistic stucco-fronted corner house over there? That was home for a while, that was (not all of it, just a room in it). Now you see that supermarket over there, that contains beer in it? That's Tesco that is. And you see that Kebab house just across the road from it over there? That's Bosphorus Kebabs that is, one of the best kebab houses in the United Kingdom. Welcome to Heaven, I hope you have a pleasant stay.  Yes it is true, in 2009 I died and went to heaven. I was living next to beer and kebabs for about two years solid, and I have the pics to prove it.  Bosphorus Kebabs is more than just a legend, it is a local institution, the holy grail of South Kensington eateries. It's a very small, compact hole in the wall, with an open-plan BBQ/serving stall situated on the right hand side, and a glass cabinet out front, displaying a vast array of various cuts of meats, namely Lamb and Chicken. Inside this rectangular chamber, the decor of the walls is dictated by a hailstorm of posty-cards that have been stuck up linearly, with blutack/sellotape, depicting the memoirs and compliments of previous diners. The national identities of each of these customers is signed off on each postcard, and I don't think there is a major city/country that is not listed on these walls, such is the diversity of all these locations; it makes the United Nations look like an Amish colony. There are a couple of seated tables to choose from, including two which are situated outside, sheltered by canopy and warmed by red-light heaters, and a nifty secluded section tucked away right at the back, should you wish to eat with a little more privacy. It's always warm in there, no matter what the weather is like outside.  Your food is cooked-to-order, and comes with a couple of warmed Pitta-breads, and a combination of salad of your choice (Red Cabbage/Onion/Tomato/Lettuce), and of course, the obligatory Chili sauce (there are a bunch of other sauces as well). Everything is home-made here, and apparently, a whole Hogget (or two) is delivered each day at the crack of dawn, and chopped up by someone down in the kitchen, into the various cuts that you see displayed at the counter. A large proportion of this Hogget goes straight into the mincer, and the resultant squidge is seen revolving around at the front of the stall, in the form of the quintessential Donner.  As far as the other meats are concerned, the choice of Lamb comes in quite a few different guises. There is the standard Lamb Shish cubes, then a couple of variations on this theme including one skewered with vegetables, a spicy version, a Lamb 'burger' (which has some green herb stuffed in the center of it), a Lamb steak, and then the king of the cabinet, the Lamb Saddleback (this one comes with either a bed of basmati rice or pitta bread or both if you like). This is a personal favourite of mine, and it is more expensive than the others. It's delicious. Everything is carved up prior to serving, including the burger, so it's hard to differentiate one version from another after it's been cooked. But this makes for easy stuffing into the warmed pitta breads. Served in tinfoil containers, there inevitably has to be some sort of construction process the second you sit down, to build your kebab, which can be quite tricky slicing the Pitta bread open and butterflying it without fraying the edges.  On the Chicken side of things, they have two small buckets on the counter containing breasts of Chicken and the other one containing the juicier counterparts, thigh sections and the like. Both are soaked in a marinade that has oodles of flavour, and once you get a taste for the Chicken, it's sometimes hard to revert back to the Lamb, simply due to the tastiness of this mouthwatering marinade.  The secret ingredient here, which I was missing during my heavenly time spent at this place, is the simple inclusion of 'table salt' to your meats. I couldn't put my finger on it all that time, but something was 'missing' from my kebabs, and for the life of me I just couldn't figure it out. Salt. They don't add salt to the meats during cooking, so it is up to you to sprinkle some salt onto the end product. It makes all the difference. Remarkably healthy, there is quite a low fat content in all of the meats here, as most of it drains out into the grill, leaving mostly lean tender meat; this, coupled with the salad and plain bread makes for healthy eating; it's certainly not fattening.  Due to it's location, reputation and style, Bosphorus transcends the 'kebab house' status and moves more into the realms of 'meat-house' so-to-speak. It's not your average kebab joint, you know like greasy Donners dripping with fat and soggy salad;

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

_zSuBvBYBCEMDMPovdYEVg.text: Late on a Sunday night the only place open in South Kensington. And it was just what other reviewers have said. Great grilled chicken and lamb. The chili sauce is hot but I like it that way. Took about 15 minutes to prepare but was cooked perfectly. Will definitely partake again.

d7wrysn0Q7HeHDSAmcJpsQ.text: Excellent! Hidden treasure in the city. We tried the shish kebab, chicken shish, lamb doner kebab and kisir. Generous portions and prices that can't be beat. We especially loved the doner kebab and ate up everything on the plates. Don't miss this if you're in the area. Seating space is very limited, though.

sf4fOMUpRVMpmlipVPuGPg.text: If you can make it all the way to here, this definitely beats those kebabs that are near Earl's Court tube station.  Quick service, food is good; you can smell it from far away.

dHyZ-8uPxzSUMpks36IDRA.text: Bosphor-meBosphor-youBosphorus......lived around the corner for 6 months and still miss it....very good doner kebab....not worth travelling across the city for but awesome if you are in the neighborhood

N7vtZEeIlUEp5gwinH48Ew.text: before heading over to London for a weeks worth of vacation I fired up the ole Yelp UK machine to see what restaurants would be worth a visit. Since the hotel was in Kensington that was where I started the search. According to Yelp the most popular spot that week was Bosphorus Kebabs serving something called a Doner.Upon further research I found out the "Doner" was something akin to a  shawarma sandwich just with some Turkish influences rather than Greek. I also realized that in comparison to most eating in London it is fairly cheap.So cheap good eats near the hotel. Well let me tell you, this is one place that  I would go out of way to eat at. The lamb and chicken are tender and juicy, the chili sauce that comes with it is spicy and brings enough heat to make the sweat just start to roll and the back of the throat get that little cough going.The place is a dive in all the best ways. Small and cramp, surly guys working the flattop. I wouldn't change a thing.

cTUWnPlQ5nA1wE02K1dXUQ.text: Unfortunately, this previously amazing place has changed owners.The quality has dropped massively, and the taste as well :(

lao8HCaHHiA8YE8Z-QeLfQ.text: Just about the best kebabs I have ever eaten were bought and hungrily snaffled here. In my estimation, that makes them the best kebabs in London too. I'm not alone there, either. While you're waiting for your 'Large Mixed' to be ready from the big sizzling grill, take a look at the back wall of this tiny, narrow restaurant for testimonials and recommendations from all around the world:"The best kebab I have ever eaten" - Hakan, Istanbul"I've driven a black cab around London for 30 years, I eat a kebab every day, and Bosphorus is still the best" - Jimmy, PeckhamThey go on and on....The boys who grill the meat and dress your kebab are quite a loud bunch. They like calling the boys 'boss' and the girls 'love', even hollering at passing people outside. The choice of sauces and salads are excellent, and you can sit inside or outside on the street. Two unique touches are the fact that you pay at the end of the meal, like a 'proper' restaurant, and the fact that you stuff your pita yourself, receiving a large container of meat and salad, with the bread seperate.But it's all about the meat. All of it is Halal, very well seasoned and cooked to perfection. I like the Lamb and the Large Mixed, but I'm confident that the whole menu is excellent. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

Ue_tYrZGRHIGbX5asafEuA.text: had a craving for grilled lamb saddle.arrived right at opening hour and the grill was just ready to go.the bespectacled old man whom i suspect is the owner was on hand to personally serve us at the grill.he still has it.skillfully grilling 4 orders at the same time.despite my cynical apprehensions, the lamb was perfectly grilled!the takeaway box of rice, vege and lamb with a splash of their spicy sauce tasted really good when i had it for lunch.the meat had time to sit and the sauce permeated the rice evenly.at 7 quid, it's both satisfying and filling.from memory, the takeaway meal tasted better than when i ate there!

xampn7KXqK1zvhUDboqycQ.text: I spent a summer interning in London, and this was by far my favorite place to eat. I love middle eastern food, and this place was authentic, plentiful, and the service was amazing. When I asked for a carry out box, they boxed up my food and even added salad to top it off. Nothing but good things to say about Bosphorus Kebab

8u3l_hdxi88DRx0AKf9U0Q.text: Good tasty lamb meat along with veggies, and multiple choices of sauce. Served inside a to-go tray with a bread. I got the large doner kebab, it was served in 3 minutes. I was out of the shop after 4 min. You can choose to stay or take out. They have a rather large menu with plenty of tasty meats facing the window for  you to look at. I took mine out and as I finished eating using the bread - and my fingers - i realized they have put a fork inside the bag which I could not see before... Anyway, good kebab, though no fries like it happens sometimes in the continent. It is filling and I will come back for sure.

hZLAZ0Posfo6rupA_E0d-g.text: Excelent meal. Nice people. Great value. Had the mixed grill, with a hummus side. I will be back again on next London trip. Just plain good. Pita was superior and the food very tasty. Loved it. Very small place but i found a table in the back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Mixed grill with hummus. Excellent

GBCGgVIf9mMkkRtMO9a-_A.text: I love a great kebab, and this was a good kebab. Thus the three stars. Prices were reasonable, about 6 quid for a large doner. The toppings and pita were tasty, and I liked the chili sauce ok. It almost tasted like Mexican salsa to me which is kinda weird.They didn't offer any other sauces, and they could have used some. Thus good, not great. Doesn't quite live up to the hype as best kebab on London.

EkVCLPhDZaJWJ1J9V3tyXQ.text: It'a an absolutely must visit place for any meat lover. Their mixed grill...that is only £7.5 for an extra large portion will satisfy all your meat cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Mixed grill in the making

Ka-lM8AXG5DUfXZsSt7cJQ.text: Tiny shop. Big flavor.We saw this place on yelp and both of us are kebab fanatics so we had to check it out. This place feels wildly out of character for South Kensington amid all the upscale shops. It's decidedly downscale and almost feels a bit dirty inside, but the tables are (mostly) clean. It is the very definition of a greasy spoon. We had an extra large donner kebab plate and a plate of "lamburger". The name is just a pun though, it's not actually a burger. Both dishes are served on a plate with a side of red cabbage, tomatoes, lettuce, and a grilled flatbread.The kebab meat was fairly standard as far as spices and cooking goes. If anything it was a bit on the dry side but it's cheap fast food and too delicious to complain about. On the other hand, the lamburger was a real treat, it was just perfectly tender and juicy. I'm not sure if the disparity has to do with the fact that all the non-kebab meats are just sitting there in the front of the store uncooked and soaking in marinade and cooked to order while the kebab is just shaved off and plated.One more thing, the atmosphere is very laid back. If you are a nervous tourist like we were you may trip over some aspects of ordering or paying. The staff are friendly enough though and will help you out if you ask.PROs:- The non-kebab cooked to order meats- The priceCONs:- VERY small inside

dwcFoHDZOBGl4IHBmnOPXA.text: It's a whole in the wall but great taste and great value. One of the best tasting kebabs out there.

_4-T07a96a56pvlTNqCk8Q.text: Five star food. Three star interior. The Kebab (I tried large mixed grill) was amazingly well cooked, tender meat. The choice was great... Although the focus is on shish rather than Donner. Absolutely loved it. Unfortunately the flip side is that the seating is cramped and pretty uncomfortable once there are more than a couple in the place. But definitely recommend.

lb5UAOpc8VQBsk2Pf5TYzg.text: Amazing food! The definition of a hole in the wall. Tiny little place run by the founder and his sons (or grandsons?). We had the doner kebab with yogurt sauce. The small was more than enough food. There are cool notes on all the walls from people all over the world dating back into the 90's (that I saw). I'll definitely be back here next time I'm in London!

5Xbgzj213ivzwW-5uWKlWw.text: Please read carefully, because the next five words will change your life:Fresh minced lamb doner kebab. Basically, you should translate that passage to mean mounds of succulent lamb carved straight off the vertical spit as you watch on with (likely) mouth agape. Served with salad and pita, it's ridiculously cheap for the amount of food you get, it's beyond delicious and so very satisfying.Just make sure to confirm there are utensils in your bag if you're getting takeway - I did ask but was disappointed to not find my promised fork when I got back to my hotel down the street. I could have phoned room service, but you try ignoring fresh minced lamb doner kebab after the floodgates, err bag, has been opened!What's a girl to do? Since I'd like to think I'm a lady, let's just say I ate it with something that rhymes with 'bands'.

ZpbnTdlaI3i3R64OsNFKZw.text: Very kind staff and tasty doner kebab!

X7IOFBm8Sc9vnSMgoX40Xw.text: Bosphorus Kebab is pretty much a hole-in-the-wall kind of place. Not much to look at and old but kind of an institution. The walls are covered in laminated notes in every language that sing its praises from years and years ago. Service was quick and efficient. The donner kebab platter only set me back £6 and the portions were plentiful only wish I could eat the pita that came with it (since I am GF). The meat is tender, salty with a slight caramelised factor thanks to this huge spit. The accompanying red cabbage flavourful while the lettuce and tomato fresh and a good counterbalance to the meat. Hummus was pretty good too! Overall if you don't care about atmosphere and food is everything, you've found yourself a winner! I have to go back and try some of the grilled meat selection in the display case at the front soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Donner kebab platter

b-_qDCkEYwYIbb2A2tppMg.text: Don't let the exterior fool you this place is by far the best kebab spot in London.Great prices and great quality meat this place is a celebrity favourite despite its humble appearance.It's steps away from South Kensington station and the perfect food on a warm summer's day. The mixed grill is absolutely delicious and I cannot recommend it enough, the combination of grilled lamb and chicken comes served with a hot pitta and mediterranean salad. I recommend asking for hummus as an extra to finish off your Turkish lunch. Highly recommend!

XkSpgNxhh_BkNuKb7dGXVw.text: One my first trip to London, 4 years ago, this was the first place I ate.  Just a whole in the wall down from the hotel we were staying at.  What could be more perfect?  And let me tell you a kebab with their spicy sauce will cure your jet lag in a hurry.  The things they server here have a bit of magic in them.  The amounts are huge and a real deal for the price.  Just 5 or 6 pounds and you are in business.  Four years later, it is still just as good and maybe better than I remembered, as I wasn't jet lagged this time!  Besides having great meats and an practiced hand on the grill, the veggies and sauces that accompany the kebabs really sets this place apart.  I know some people are scared of the doner but it is pretty good and orders of magnitude better than any  doner I've had anywhere else.  But their other kebabs are as amazing or better.  I want to try them all, but that means I'm just greedy!  Get on the tube and go there now!The guy working the counter just laughed at me when I told him I had been waiting four years for their kebabs!  But it is true, and I hope the wait isn't as look next time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

xotz97WFZFFDXa2YVCIZDA.text: Really impressive. The quality of döner is no less than what you find in Turkey. Also, the service is very friendly. I've seen that everyone leaves there happily and totally satisfied.

4F7a8aeMKjC7bEyAK7Wjqw.text: Be it known, Yanks: kebab as it's known here is more akin to what you would expect as a gyro. Do not raise your hopes for the most wondrous of wondrous: meat on a stick. Or, you know, you could read the reviews and look at the pictures. Since, evidently, I couldn't be bothered to do either, I was slightly surprised at what I received. That said, what I received was good. I went with the standard favorite, the doner kebab. As with what i usually find at similar shops, I had no where near enough pita to enjoy with the meat but the few(ish) bites of meat/bread combo I experienced, I enjoyed. Salad's salad. I appreciate the effort but I would have gladly traded the green for some additional pita. As I mentioned above, the meat was good. It was a bit too salty for my liking, hence a three-star as opposed to a four. I also had a bit of diner's envy when I saw another patron order the spicy kofte. From looks and aroma, I think I should have gone with that selection. Be also advised: this place is tiny. While you may be so famished that you have no choice other than to sit and eat, a more enjoyable experience may be to pick up and take away. You pay after you eat. I don't know why, but I rather enjoyed that. I think there's a modicum of greater respect in such a transaction.

4SLm-_lEAaLr6jSwuKan3g.text: This is the kind of review you have to qualify with: it's good for a ...Kebab joints are gross, and this one is no different.  It's dirty, service curt, inefficiently run, but for a kebab shop, its pretty good.  The meat is not as poor quality as others around town, and after ingesting it you don't feel like getting your stomach pumped, but there are some serious issues.  (1) no chips, (2) pita sucks, (3) they serve everything on salad not as a wrap, (4) salad sucks, and finally, (5) rice is awful.  If they were to correct the chips and wrap deficiencies I think I'd go there rather than the offensively pretentious Beirut Express next door (they don't allow sandwiches/wraps in the 'dining area' and even if the entire dining area is completely empty will make you wait for a table in the front to each a sandwich, even if your dining companion is having a full meal).  Places like Best Mangal, Mangal Ocakbasi, etc., offer as good or better meat plus have full menus, table service, etc., etc., so don't really see the appeal of a kebab stand, esp. one which isn't even open when I'd ever want a kebab (read: when pigeon toed on booze).

fQzAlfkTmhiW8LurcXUxAw.text: Just ate there, with the advice of Yelp reviews, and really liked it. Is the decor great? Absolutely not. Was everyone pretty friendly -- especially to my two students who were completely unprepared for what a kebab is? -- definitely. Good food, good price, even got to sit at the tables on the street and enjoy watching people pass. Looking forward to eating here again.

0kVzFRJvqGsWpTFkydOloA.text: Stayed in London for a week and went here twice. Hole in the wall with great service, good value -- loved the lamb kebabs.

tvemXjGdT7Lbs1iU6DQKnQ.text: Not a large place but very good food, helpful staff, as well as fair prices. I accidentally overpaid and they noticed and gave back the extra--so honest too. Everything was good but nothing beat the Donner.

I4TuGRmXNi_WXJfjG0A32g.text: I trusted the Yelp reviews and they were right.After spending a day at the museums I was starving. I walked over and ordered an XL mixed grill. The portion was huge for £9.70 I could barely finish it. Topped with vegetables and a pita.The only thing I would change is to order just lamb next time. Although the chicken was good I always prefer lamb when eating this type of food.He only put red sauce on it. Maybe they don't have tzatziki?The guy cooking was very nice and he was talking to regulars which is a good sign. This place is not touristy, a hole in the wall with just a few tables.Cash only!

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Menu July 2018
Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Xl mixed grill

_RtObYTEp7x8Xs60GrwOfA.text: Small hole in the wall resturant, that serves fresh, inexpensive food. I had the lamb a couple times. It was seasoned nicely. Cheap and quick. Recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

-z8ZH-ditppZu_k3oJ7QEQ.text: I ordered the mixed grill. Overall, I really enjoyed it. The lamb and sausage pieces were my favorite. Also comes with a salad and a piece of pita bread on the side. It's one of the better meals I've had in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

LfpbMjfm2HTp620fYYwNKw.text: Plain and simple. 5 Stars and anyone who rated it less...well, they must have had a bad day. Fresh meat cooked perfectly, salad and tzatziki sauce bar none. If I lived close, I'd be here at least once a week. DANG!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

sKc96b31_OSdHmGMq3U1uw.text: This place only accepts cash.The food is great. The people working here are hilarious. The place is small but it is never really packed. The meat was extremely tender. Be careful, there were some bones.

l6yzWgvg-YkpfI5C7NevOA.text: My friend recommended this place since i was going to london, i wanted to give it a try so i went in the morning once it open, the person that greeted us and the staff were very friendly. I order the shish kebab and friend ordered the mixed grill.My shish kebab with the small salad on the side was amazing and my friend enjoyed her mixed grill plate too.Everything was great, a must go if you're in london

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

QCKMdgi1Ux33l-vTCyulSQ.text: This place is a little hole in the wall and they only accept notes!! There are plenty of kebabs that you can choose from and they all look fresh. I ordered the large classic shish kebab plate and got everything on it. The plate comes with a piece of naan bread, which was pretty decent. The meat of the shish kebab was pretty tasty and went well with the assorted toppings. There was salsa that added the most flavor to the meat. The portion sizing was relatively small and the meat was a little tough. I definitely want to give it another try and get the lamb plate because it looked pretty awesome!

j8QiUN826zDxcTYdbpBn3Q.text: Amazing place. Great food, good service, and very friendly staff. Quick and quality food with a smile on the faces of the staff.

kY2v46ehPOyeO4MACH1bCQ.text: We ordered XL Mixed Grill Kebob and xL Donner Kebab.  Good flavor!  Good value for money

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

m_GsBEUxLwA9ZvyjhaARhw.text: These were the best kabobs I've ever had and I'm no spring chicken. Huge platter of meat salad with yogurt sauce. The owner was so sweet the food was great. It's a tiny clean little place with very friendly employees. I'll definitely go back!!!

5l4XXecGnJfR4pbNHKSMQw.text: This place is a gem. Organic fresh meat. Tastiest kebab outside of turkey, Iran etc. Hole in the wall, the guys are always friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Doner kebab w salad no bread

XndwmtKauq23p8hBqzFAiw.text: His place keep me feed while living in South Ken.The food is fresh.Make sure to get the sides.

GX7ANtel56dtntQhYX2sGw.text: Fantastic place nearby the South Kensington tube station. It's a hole in the wall with not much place to sit, so we took our food to go. Everything on the menu is very reasonably priced. I think the most expensive thing was £10. For a family of 5, we got 2 XL mixed grills and 2 Chicken Kebab's (one chicken breast and one chicken thigh skewer). In terms of quality, I've never had a more tender and delicious selection of kebabs to choose from. We had chicken, beef and lamb and they were all marinated and cooked to perfection. Would highly recommend visiting this place if you're in town and nearby visiting Kensington Palace since it's basically walking distance.

w_vf9ODPobVHTp1iP-uNyQ.text: All the reviews left me thinking this is the best kebab shop in London, shit even the world. I don't know what these locals/tourists are smoking.I ordered a medium lamb shish kebab. Service was fine. Now the food...The lamb pieces were a little chewy though had *some* good flavors. A bit lukewarm. They're served with an ok, lukewarm pita bread and a cold, bland bed of purple cabbage, chopped lettuce and tons of raw onions! Why?? No addition sauce was offered except a tomato-chili sauce added in top of meat.I guess for $6 it's a good deal but I wouldn't even pay this to eat here. The reason why I'm leaving a harsh review is due to the pumping up of reputation this place has. I've had better kebabs in Turkey as well as other countries in the world. This place does not deserve to advertise their food in such manner.

cAhWaAIE2I-FfyEcuPx1ug.text: Best Kebabs in London. The meat is also so tender and fresh and cooked to perfection! Get the mixed grill, with salad, and chili sauce. Their hummus and pita are excellent too! The shop is tiny, but the flavour is amazing!

cL4aecyO3A8xAaZ4wmNm_Q.text: Excellent meal. Even let me pay when I had finished. It was very much worth the search. Great kebab! You can choose the portion of meat as well. Excellent quality, and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Bosphorus Kebabs - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Doner Kebab

07I-8JeYxQUMa-s00n7OAw.text: Holy crap this was amazing. I got the shish kofte and it came with a salad, chili sauce, and pita flatbread. The place is small and not impressive but you can tell the taste of the food makes it a favorite among locals and tourists. The walls have feedback cards written by previous customers that you can read while eating.

R_Xg7atA8B_Ncd4XDHPFbw.text: My wife and I had gone to the original Shahi Naan Kebab on the My wife and I had gone to the original Shahi Naan Kebab on the bridge in Southall some 35 years ago and it was superb so recently while in the area we visited the new one. Alas it... in Southall some 35 years ago and it was superb so recently while in the area we visited the new one. Alas it...

sYKN_kPhkRd7LjbMxvySWQ.text: Don't understand the high reviews for this place. The only good thing is the cheap prices. Food was mediocre and lamb and chicken were pretty flavorless. I have had rotisserie lamb at many other places that have been much better than this place with much more flavor. Just an okay place, would not eat here again.

OOLo47cM5PrBESykmPFTJg.text: Excellent. I loved it. Great food great prices. We will come back again. Best kebap in London
